p: Unlike the seasonal viral infections responsible for influenza epidemics that have accustomed us to consider vaccines as a safe and timely solution, or other infections such as HIV or hepatitis C that we treat with state-of-the-art antiviral agents, COVID-19 and its respiratory aftermaths must be considered as potentially incurable. In fact, during the relatively short evolution of this pandemic, it has not yet been possible to develop a vaccine or identify truly effective drugs against this virus.
